page.title: 01HISTORY OF AREA
page.content:
SOUTH WOODHAM FERRERS NEW TOWN THE TOWN WAS DESIGNATED A NEW GROWTH AREA BY ESSEX COUNTY COUNCIL IN THE LATE 1970'S. THE POPULATION IS EXPECTED TO REACH 18,000 PEOPLE. MANY FAMILIES ARE NEW TO THE AREA WHICH HAS A FAST HOUSING GROWTH. THE TOWN CENTRE REFLECTS TRADITIONAL VILLAGE ARCHITECTURE AND ILLUSTRATES DIVERSE USAGE OF NATURAL BUILDING MATERIALS.
THE RIVER CROUCH IS A MAIN SOURCE OF RECREATION AND SEPARATES HULLBRIDGE VILLAGE AND SOUTH WOODHAM FERRERS. IN THE PAST SCHOOL CHILDREN WERE FERRIED OR WALKED ACROSS THE RIVER TO HULLBRIDGE WHICH HAD THE ONLY SCHOOL IN THAT AREA.
